website_summaries.verdict: Costs a pretty penny, but these are very durable, work extremely well, and will last for a long time.
pros: infrared really lightens up objects at night

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: This is Gen1+ and wasn't really impressed. I have a spotting scope and rifle scope that are of way better quality. If you want a headset you need to get at least Gen 2. Overall not a bad product but the IR light had low lumen output and tube had artifacts in it. Wasn't impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: ... some items that were not included not really crucial like the dust cloth but the battery was supposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it there some items that were not included not really crucial like the dust cloth but the battery was supposed to be included so it seemed that it was used and not new so i bought a slightly better unit a i gen. It hasn't arrived yet so I need one for star gazing and a u tube video showed it was able to do that, where the Yukon it didn't work good enough for distance viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Dru-Droid

customer_reviews.title: An edge when its dark
customer_reviews.text: It is simple to swap the monocular over to the left eye. That puts the control buttons on the bottom, but so what. I don't have a large head (I seem to recall that I wore a 7 1/4 Bell Star helmet back in the day) but in order for the headgear to be comfortable I pretty much took two of the straps out to their fullest extent. I'm not impressed by the padding of the headgear - I have my doubts if it could be worn for hours without discomfort. But when it gives you a real edge over anything without the ability to see in IR, well, one just has to make a few allowances.
customer_reviews.author: don't have a witty username

customer_reviews.title: Be advised
customer_reviews.text: good for giving to your family and friends who don't have NV, and decent for hunting. if you don't have either of those in mind, you'll be disappointed with Gen 1. be patient and save your money for a PVS14 instead
customer_reviews.author: basedcheese

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool to own.
customer_reviews.text: Took it out for a test run and it does work. Limited range of 75 yards but its better than using a flashlight if your trying to keep a low profile. Head mount kit is uncomfortable but usable. For under 200 its worth it just incase things ever get bad wouldent pay more than 250 for it.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Night Vision Scope Head-Mount
customer_reviews.text: Read some negative reviews and almost didn't buy this, but I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: RLyons

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: These work well for the money spent. Yukon NVMT 1x24 night vision. No problems to report and I haven't had any complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Lenses fog bad. I'm trying out a 3rd brands of defogger ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get the fit right. Lenses fog bad. I'm trying out a 3rd brands of defogger tonight. Also the one eye sucks!!!!!! Very hard to use. I am getting one that covers both eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Batteries?
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't come with a battery, so if you are looking for them, it takes a CR123a battery. Good product for what it is worth.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan W.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this at night as he and his friends are playing spy or hiding games. Was very handy when we lost power for a few days after a storm.
customer_reviews.author: loud

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but, needs better headgear
customer_reviews.text: The optics are pretty good for a Gen1, but, the skull crusher (mount) is for a toddler or something. It didn't fit at all.
customer_reviews.author: That One Dude

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my husband since he is a kid at heart. HE LOVED IT. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: What I got was meh.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it, received it. Upon opening I was greeted with the head mount and no monocular. So can't really review that. However, the mounting hardware came in the box of disappointment, and it was of good build quality, but not very comfortable at all. Straps had little wiggle room and the foam pads on the plastic were hard as rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I have used NVD's that cost a lot more money that did not work much better. Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: USPatriotOne

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The mount works great if you have something on underneath it, but holds the device well. This does help quite well and use a red filtered light to help light up areas far away.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bagwell

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price, but not the best product on the market by far. Headset is rather uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Carl S.

customer_reviews.title: Yukon NVMT
customer_reviews.text: The monocular functions as expected (for an inexpensive unit). Visibility on a clear (but not much moonlight night) was 80 yds. The IR allows "bright vision" for 10 ft, but no noticeable help beyond. The head-mount system is not very comfortable and if your hat size is bigger than 71/2, you will have trouble, since the strap adjustments don't give you any more. For the price, this equipment is a good deal, but if you want super night vision, you will have to pay $$$ for Gen 2 and above.
customer_reviews.author: leek2065

customer_reviews.title: magnification is fine. The head gear is somewhat awkward
customer_reviews.text: They work well, magnification is fine. The head gear is somewhat awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Underwood

customer_reviews.title: worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: Much clearer and brighter than I expected for the money. Headset could use a longer chin strap but I made it work.I can't wait I go camping and really get away from light with it. Will buy a backu soon. Get the rechargeable battery pack too.
customer_reviews.author: travis

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price. Just need to be sure you follow the directions and take care of it
customer_reviews.author: Harris Platt

customer_reviews.title: The night vision is great it works just as described
customer_reviews.text: The night vision is great it works just as described, the head mount i had a problem with, the strap under the chin was to short. I had to make some of my own adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: for the price its hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: head mount + good gen 1 for a good price is hard to find and beat this setup. You can upgrade the optics with higher magnification. I went out night hunting and these things are a good alternative to shining. I have to admit it took me a good 1 hour to really get use to them, but once i got use to them i was able to move around and spot incoming pray after calling it at night with no lights. I love em.
customer_reviews.author: ericred

customer_reviews.title: Skull crusher!
customer_reviews.text: Have to agree with some of the other reviewers, the head mount is a skull crusher! overall it is a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mount hurts your head
customer_reviews.text: It's not comfortable. I didn't expect great or even good. But this is just plain bad... and that's without the weight of the NVG! The plastic on the front of the forehead is barely curved to fit your head, so it pulls hard. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: L8er N8er

customer_reviews.title: Overall quality appears to be good, however the field of view is very narrow ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall quality appears to be good, however the field of view is very narrow and that is the only reason I am giving it 4-stars. Visibility in low light conditions is very good. For the price I do not think you could find a better value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Head Mount Only, no Night Vision
customer_reviews.text: Received the "Compact Head Mount" not the night vision monocular. No optics included, just the head mount. Returned item as it was not what I ordered, nor is as described, nor worth $274.We thought we were purchasing the head mount AND the NV monocular, especially for the price. No one would confuse the price asked for simply a head mount, unless it was the US military.
customer_reviews.author: RSF Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: Its ...OK...but...
customer_reviews.text: Generation one is what is. If you are not a professional, alright, but I would not recommend if there is danger involved. With caution you can walk with them, but you need to focus constantly.The image is clear only in the center of the visual field.The head mount is plastic, difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: For the price it's okay
customer_reviews.text: I have many night vision devices, some REALLY good ones, and some cheap ones to throw around in the truck and keep handy without the great fear of it being stolen. Clarity is just what you'd expect from a GEN 1 device; actually, their bino's are much better and I have two pair of them.
customer_reviews.author: PJDSR

customer_reviews.title: Serious flaw; returned to seller
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Although you shouldn't expect much for the low price, it has a red light that shows when the unit it on...on the outside of the unit for people to see! I'll write again, the red light is on the outside of the unit (facing away from you) that people can see.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: It works as described. You do have to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: It works as described. You do have to keep it in focus for the distance you want to see (understandably).
customer_reviews.author: John R Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer:-)
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Great price. Fast shipping. This was a gift and was asked for spefically by my boyfriend. He absolutly loves it and says it is the best quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica LaSalla

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It did not work at all and I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Frank T.

customer_reviews.title: thank you
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product thank you very much have been enjoying it since it arrived thanks again
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this product to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I know this is generation one technology but I could see just about as well in the dark without this night vision. Spend some more money and buy a good product
customer_reviews.author: Bf

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD PIC...DOES NOT INCLUDE SCOPE! DONT BE FOOOOOOLED
customer_reviews.text: this pic clearly depicts a scope...I wasted 20$ on this FALSE ADVERTISING!
customer_reviews.author: lexchance

product_meta.title: Yukon NVMT 1x24 Head Mount Kit
product_meta.description:
The NVMT 1x24 Head Gear Kit incorporates the exciting element of hands-free night vision with the quality and value of a 1x24 monocular. The NVMT 1x24 monocular uses no magnification so that users can see a clear image with no distortion or change in depth perception. The small, compact monocular is secured to the head gear by a mounting system that sits easily on the front head strap so that the NVMT can be flipped up when not in use or flipped down when activated; the NVMT head gear is designed to be used with your right eye only and can not be interchanged for the left. The 1x24 also features separately activated Pulse system IR illuminator that uses a pulsating infrared beam to enhance night vision viewing capabilities. A simple detaching mechanism allows the monocular to be taken off the mount for hand-held use. Additional accessories for the NVMT 1x24 are the NVMT IR Flashlight, Riflescope Conversion Kit and Digital Camera Adapter. The NVMT Goggle 1x24 is backed by Yukon’s Limited Lifetime Warranty.

AMAZON.COM
The NVMT 1x24 Head Gear Kit combines a compact and lightweight 1x24 monocular with generation 1 night vision capabilities and secure headgear that positions the monocular for hands-free viewing. The NVMT 1x24 monocular uses no magnification so that users can see a clear image without distortion or change in depth perception. The small, compact monocular is secured to the head gear by a mounting system that sits easily on the front head strap. The monocular can be flipped up when not in use and flipped down when activated. (please note: the NVMT head gear is designed to be used with your right eye only and can not be interchanged for the left). The 1x24 also features separately activated Pulse system IR illuminator that uses a pulsating infrared beam to enhance night vision viewing capabilities. A simple detaching mechanism allows the monocular to be taken off the mount for hand-held use.

 Key Features:

 * Hands-free operation 
 * Photo/Video equipment adaptable 
 * Integrated (25mW) IR illuminator with focusing beam 
 * Integrated "On/Off" and "IR activation" LED indicators 
 * Two built-in 1/4-inch tripod sockets 
 * Weather resistant construction 
 * Lens cap secured to the monocular body 
 * Limited Lifetime Warranty 

 Specifications:

 * Image Intensifier tube classification: Gen 1 
 * Magnification: 1x 
 * Lens diameter: 24 millimeters 
 * Field of view: 30 degrees 
 * Resolution (typical): 32 to 36 lp/mm 
 * Focus range: one yard to infinity 
 * Eye relief: 12 millimeters 
 * Diopter adjustment: +/- 4 
 * Detection distance (approximate): up to 160 yards 
 * Effective IR illuminator distance: up to 100 yards 
 * Power supply: 3V (CR 123A) battery 
 * Estimated battery life (without IR): up to 30 hours 
 * Operating temperature: -22 to +104 degrees Fahrenheit 
 * Dimensions (without head gear): 5.6 by 3.4 by 2.4 inches 
 * Weight (without head gear): 13.4 ounces 

 What's in the Box?
NVMT Head Gear (#29031), protective carrying case, wrist strap
